neighbors.name: Commonwealth of Virginia Board of Game & Inland Fisheries (now Department of Wildlife Resources)
neighbors.claims: The Commonwealth of Virginiaâ€™s Board of Game & Inland Fisheries (renamed the Department of Wildlife Resources or DWR in 2020) is the state agency responsible for managing inland wildlife and fisheries ([Virginia DWR](https://www.virginia.gov/agencies/department-of-game-and-inland-fisheries/)). In 2017, the agency paid $9 million for roughly 2,900 acres in western Spotsylvania County to establish the Oakley Forest Wildlife Management Area (WMA) ([Outdoors Rambler](https://www.outdoorsrambler.com/post/2017/11/29/virginia-opening-wildlife-management-area-in-spotsylvania-county-needed-access)). By 2023, the Oakley Forest WMA had expanded to approximately 4,459 acres ([Virginia DWR](https://dwr.virginia.gov/wma/oakley-forest/)). The DWR provides regulatory guidance for solar energy facilities, recommending specific wildlife protection measures such as perimeter fencing standards (maximum 61 inches or minimum 96 inches) to prevent deer entrapment and the preservation of native vegetative buffers ([Virginia DWR](https://dwr.virginia.gov/wp-content/uploads/media/Solar-Energy-Facility-Guidance.pdf)).
neighbors.influence_justification: State regulatory agency and owner of ~4,459 acres (Oakley Forest WMA) in county.

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate through DWR Environmental Services staff regarding wildlife corridor mapping, pollinator plantings, and fencing specifications to ensure regulatory compliance.
